overviews.title: MBA in Operations Management: Course Fees, Admission 2026, Syllabus, Top Colleges, Career Scope
overview: MBA in Operations Management is a two-year PG degree course offered in full-time as well as part-time mode. It is a popular specialization among management aspirants as operations form the bedrock of a business enterprise. Working professionals with 2-5 years of experience can pursue an Executive MBA in operations management. One can pursue an MBA in Operations full-time as well as part-time.

MBA in Operations Syllabus focuses on Planning, organization, and supervision of production, manufacturing, and service operations. The skills that are developed in the students after pursuing MBA in Operations are Analytical thinking, problem-solving, decision-making, process optimization, and leadership. This course will help the students in their management career because of the good future scope after this course, because of the Growing e-commerce, manufacturing, and service sectors increasing demand for operations experts.

After the completion of the course, the MBA in Operations Management Graduates have multiple benefits like a strong corporate demand, versatile career paths, and global opportunities. MBA in Operations students also have scope in Government jobs in Logistics & supply roles in PSUs, Indian Railways, and government procurement departments.

MBA in Operations Management is gaining popularity day by day, owing to an increase in the number of companies and more and more individuals commencing their own firms. You can have a look at the table below, which contains all the important points relating to the MBA in Operations Management course level, eligibility, entrance exams, job profiles, and recruiters.
Entrance Exam, Group Discussion, and Personal Interview

faqs.question: What is MBA in Operations Management?
faqs.answer: Operations Management is an area of management that is made to teach students aspects like designing, and controlling the process of production and redesigning business operations in the production of goods or services. It also involves the responsibility of checking that the business operations are efficient in terms of using as few resources as needed and effective in terms of meeting customer requirements. It is concerned with managing the process that converts inputs (in the forms of raw materials, labor, and energy) into outputs (in the form of goods and/or services). An MBA in Operations Management is a 2-year postgraduate professional degree program that helps you specialize in these aspects. Hope it helps!!!

faqs.question: What is the scope of MBA in Operations Management?
faqs.answer: Given the business world's continual growth, there is a great requirement for operations managers. In recent years, the number of career choices available after an MBA in Operations Management has increased dramatically. A global perspective on market dynamics is offered by an MBA in Operations Management education , which can assist a student in satisfying client demand. MBA in Operations Management is growing more important as e-commerce grows. In recent years, the number of career choices available after an MBA in Operations Management has increased dramatically. The graduates of MBA in Operations Management can find employment in both the private and government sectors. Hope this helps!!!

faqs.question: Why should I choose MBA in Operation Management course?
faqs.answer: Efficiency is one of the finest reasons to seek a career in operations management . Operations Management ensures that personnel is properly matched to resources to get the best possible results. The MBA in Operations curriculum and courses give students the conceptual frameworks and advanced analytics they need to manage and create operational processes more effectively. One of the strongest reasons to seek a career in operations management is a good package. The average annual salary of a graduate after Operation Management is around INR 6 LPA , which is higher than MBA pass-outs of other streams. Students can find employment in several sectors as companies nowadays are looking up for professionals having this background.

syllabus_section.title: MBA in Operations Management Syllabus
description: The course structure and syllabus of the MBA in Operations are the same as that of other MBA programs . In the first year of the program, candidates study core subjects about skills associated with all aspects of Business Administration. In the second year, students have to choose elective subjects relevant to the Operations domain. After the first year is completed, students go through summer training or industry training of six to eight weeks duration, which is meant to improve the practical knowledge of the student.

faqs.question: Which is the most difficult subject in MBA in Operations?
faqs.answer: Though the difficulty of a subject completely depends on your area of interest and strengths, Quantitative Methods and Analytics, Supply Chain Management, Production Planning & Control, and Operation Strategy are some subjects that you may find tough, as these subjects contain mathematical models, data analysis, balancing, etc. Hope this helps!!! faqs.question: What are the important subjects covered in an MBA in Operations Management syllabus?
faqs.answer: The Syllabus of MBA in Operation has core and elective subjects. These courses are often supported by case studies, internships, and industry projects to provide practical insights. Some of the important subjects covered are mentioned below for your reference - Operations Strategy Supply Chain Management Project Management Logistics Management Quality Management Lean and Six Sigma Inventory Management Not satisfied with answer? salary_section.title: MBA in Operations Management Career Scope: Job Profiles, Salary and Top Recruiters
description: MBA in Operations Management graduates are in demand in every field and every domain as the business has moved forward technologically. The MBA in Operations Management program gives graduates a variety of options. Depending on the specialization they have chosen, students can explore a wide range of MBA in Operations Management job opportunities . The MBA in Operations Management scope of work for a postgraduate is extensive and varies across a broad range of working fields and industries.

Graduates in MBA Operations have a plethora of job roles to choose from. Since it deals with both technical and managerial aspects of business, managers get attractive designations and handsome salary packages. Given below is the list of average salaries offered to MBA in Operations graduates.

job_profiles.description: An Operations Manager is a professional responsible for overseeing and managing the daily operations of a business or organization.
A Data Analyst is a professional who collects, organizes, and analyzes data to provide insights and recommendations to inform business decisions.
A Human Resource Manager (HRM) is a professional who is responsible for managing an organization's workforce.
The primary responsibility would be to oversee and manage the entire supply chain process, from procurement to distribution, ensuring that all aspects run smoothly and efficiently.
A General Operations Manager is an executive who oversees the day-to-day operations of a company or organization.

faqs.question: What is the scope for MBA in Operations Management in India?
faqs.answer: After completing your MBA in Operations Management successfully, you can start your professional career in multiple industries like E-commerce, Information Technology, Logistics, Manufacturing, Supply Chain, also in Consulting . You can become an Operations Manager, Data Analyst, HR Manager, Supply Chain Program Manager , and more. The average salary of an Operations Manager in India is INR 10.8 LPA . Read more about - ⁠ MBA in Operations Management Hope this helps!!!

faqs.question: Which is the highest paying job profile after MBA in Operations Management?
faqs.answer: The salary package most of the times depends on the company you're working for, your skills, experience, geographical location , etc. Though there are many great employment options after an MBA in Operations Management, the average salary of a Supply Chain Manager in India is INR 14.4 LPA . However, salary packages get increased with work experience. Hope this helps!!!

faq_section.title: FAQs on MBA in Operations Management
introduction: Candidates can refer to this section for FAQs on MBA in Operations Management .

faqs.question: What is the average salary of an Operations Manager in India?
faqs.answer: An operations manager earns up to INR 7.2 Lacs annually in India . The average salary for an Operations Manager position in India is INR 3.5–15 LPA. A lot of variables affect an employee's starting pay when they begin a new job. The characteristics that affect income after receiving an MBA in Operations Management include work experience, interpersonal abilities, area of specialisation, and specialisation expert.

faqs.question: Is an MBA in Operations Management suitable for engineers?
faqs.answer: Yes, an MBA in Operations Management is very well-suited for engineers. Engineering graduates already have the technical expertise and problem-solving skills that are needed and which align well with the analytical and process-driven nature of operations management. This MBA provides a business perspective to their technical knowledge, opening up leadership roles in manufacturing, supply chain, and logistics. Hope this helps!!!

faqs.question: What are some free tools I can learn before or during my MBA in Operations?
faqs.answer: Some of the toolkit to boost your resume that you can learn before starting your journey with MBA in Operations are menioned below - Use your free time before MBA to get ahead with these! List: Excel (Advanced) - Pivot tables, VLOOKUP, dashboards; Google Sheets - For collaborative planning; Power BI / Tableau - Visual analytics; Asana / Trello - Task & project management; Canva / PPT - For business presentations; Khan Academy or MITx (edX) - Basics of Operations Management; Coursera : “Supply Chain Operations” by Rutgers University

faqs.question: Can I pursue an MBA in Operations online or through distance mode?
faqs.answer: Yes, many reputed institutions now offer online, distance and executive MBAs in Operations that is designed for working professionals also those who need flexibility. Top options are mentioned below: The Duration of these programs are usually 1- 2 years and the eligibility is Bachelor's degree + work experience (for executive MBAs) List: NMIMS Global – MBA (Operations Management) - AICTE approved; IGNOU – PG Diploma in Operations Management; Amity Online, Sikkim Manipal, Symbiosis Center for Distance Learning (SCDL); IIM Kozhikode / IIM Ahmedabad - ePGP programs with Ops as elective; Great Learning, UpGrad, Coursera also offer Ops modules via collaborations with top B-schools

addmision.title: MBA in Operations Admission 2026: Dates, Eligibility, Fees, & Selection Process
overview: MBA in Operations Admission 2025 is presently underway in a number of management colleges across India. The process for MBA in Operation Management Admissions is ongoing. Candidates, who wish to pursue an MBA in Operations must have scored at least 50 percent marks in graduation and also got an impressive score in national level exams like CAT, XAT, NMAT, MAT, SNAP, and CMAT to ensure entry to the top management colleges in India.

Aspirants can pursue MBA Operations in full-time, part-time, distance, and online modes. The course can be pursued at fees ranging from INR 4 lakh to 25 lakh. Registration for the CAT exam, a national-level management aptitude test conducted by the prestigious Indian Institute of Management (IIM) .

After the completion of an MBA in Operations, students can be placed as Operations Executives, Area Operations Managers, and Operational Research Analysts, with an annual income of INR 7.12 lakh. Students can read on to get more admission-related information.
MBA in Operations Management Latest Updates:
The CAT 2025 registration is now open for admission to MBA/PGDM courses. The last date to register is Sep 13, 2025 . Furthermore, the CAT 2025 exam is scheduled to be held on Nov 30, 2025 .

NMAT 2025 registration has started for admission to MBA/PGDM courses for the academic session 2026-28. Candidates can register until Oct 10, 2025 . Furthermore, the NMAT 2025 exam window will be open from November 5 to December 19, 2025 .
The XAT registration process 2026 is now open for MBA/PGDM courses. The last date to register is Dec 5, 2025. Furthermore, the XAT 2026 exam will be held on January 4, 2026 .

sections.heading: MBA in Operations Management Admission 2025: Eligibility Criteria

Understanding these requirements is essential for a smooth application process. This section provides details on the eligibility criteria for the MBA in Operations programs offered by various colleges in India.

sections.heading: General Eligibility Criteria for MBA in Operations Management

content.text: To enroll in an MBA in Operations Management program at some universities, candidates must achieve a good score on any national admission exam. Depending on category preferences and a college's reputation, different cut-off scores may apply. There are no age restrictions for enrolling in this course because everyone who meets the prerequisites is eligible. Interested students need to meet the following eligibility criteria to ensure admission to the MBA in Operations Management program:

items: A Bachelor's degree in any discipline or an equivalent qualification with a minimum of 50 percent or equivalent CGPA from a recognized university
In most of the government as well as private colleges, there is a 5 percent score relaxation for SC/ST candidates.
For pursuing an Executive MBA in Operations, work experience of three to five years is necessary.

content.text: Note: This information is sourced from different sources and may vary.

Students can pursue MBA Operations from a number of private and government colleges. The aspirants can shortlist colleges  The standard admission procedure for almost every college is the same and students can check the below points to get a general idea.

items: The candidates' initial step is to decide which college or institute they want to apply to.

Candidates must then check the requirements for the entrance exam. Most of the institutes follow the minimum score criteria in Graduation which are 50 percent on average or equivalent from a recognized university.
For reserved category students, the minimum score is 45 percent in aggregate.
The next step for candidates is to determine whether they are qualified to apply to that specific institution or institute.
Applicants must submit an application and pay the required fees . They must appear for the entrance exam with good preparation to have a valid score.
Candidates can later check their exam results and if they’re through they can complete the remaining steps.

sections.heading: MBA in Operations Admission 2025: Entrance Exams

content.text: The admission process for MBA in Operations is the same as MBA/PGDM programs as this specialization is offered in the MBA course. Most of the colleges for MBA in Operations admit students based on entrance exam scores, group discussions, and personal interviews .
Given below is the list of top MBA in Operations Entrance Exams the scores of which are valid for admission to various B-schools in India:

rows: MBA in Operations Management Entrance Exams
MAT PBT - 31 May ' 25 MAT CBT - 08 Jun ' 25

sections.heading: MBA in Operations Admission 2025: Entrance Exam Syllabus

content.text: MBA Operations entrance exam syllabus contains topics relating to Verbal Ability and Reading Comprehension, Logical Reasoning, Data Interpretation, Quantitative Aptitude, and General Awareness. Below is a brief description of a few popular MBA entrance exam syllabus:

rows: The CAT exam syllabus includes three subjects – Verbal Ability & Reading Comprehension (VARC), Data Interpretation & Logical Reasoning (DILR), and Quantitative Aptitude (QA) . The main topics of focus while covering the CAT syllabus are Arithmetic, Algebra, Geometry, Percentages, Graphs, English Grammar, Coding-Decoding, Series Completion, etc.

MAT Syllabus includes Language Comprehension, Intelligence and Critical Reasoning, Data Analysis and Sufficiency, Mathematical Skills, and Indian and Global Environment. The syllabus for MAT has been designed to check the candidate’s analytical skills, logical aptitude, English comprehension, and general awareness.
The XAT exam syllabus includes topics from Decision Making, Verbal & Logical Ability, Quantitative Ability & Data Interpretation, and General Knowledge.
CMAT Syllabus consists of five subjects – Quantitative Techniques & Data Interpretation, Logical Reasoning, Language Comprehension, General Awareness, and Innovation & Entrepreneurship.
SNAP syllabus includes topics from General English, Quantitative Ability, and Reasoning like other entrance exam syllabus.

sections.heading: MBA in Operations Admission 2025: Quick Preparation Tips

content.text: Keeping in view the growing competition, admissions to the top MBA colleges is not a cakewalk. Students need to prepare well for the entrance exams that will decide their fate and career progress. MBA preparations for 2025 call for in-depth subject-by-subject research and practice with model questions. The entrance tests a candidate decides to take should determine the preparation plan. All applicants should prepare for the MBA exam in general, but they should adjust their strategy in light of the exam's format. The general preparation approach for all MBA entrance exams is shown below:

items: Identify Requirements : Before applying to a college for MBA admission, students must have a thorough awareness of the requirements and accepted test scores for that institution.
Entrance Exams : The aspirants should understand which colleges accept which entrance tests and then plan their whole preparation according to their preferences for colleges.
Select Specialisation : The candidates need to select their MBA specialization and program from among the numerous prestigious B-schools in India.
Calculate Fees : The aspirants should also be aware of the updated fee structure of the MBA program before taking admission to any college.

AICTE/UGC Approved Institutes : The candidates should also be aware of the colleges that are approved by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE)/University Grants Commission (UGC) as it increases the reliability of the institute.
Know exam patterns and the weightage of various sections in the examination as well as the negative marking and time limit for various examinations.
Understand and memorize the syllabus thoroughly to prepare a strategy for the easy and difficult topics and analyze the most important and mark-fetching areas in exams.
Refer to limited sources to avoid confusion and clear the basic concepts. Candidates can refer to basic books for Reasoning and Verbal Ability and refer to guidebooks for Management aptitude.
Prepare a timetable to prioritize the important subjects and cover all topics for reading as well as revisions.
Refer to PYQs to understand the difficulty of the examination and prepare effectively for the most repeated areas.
Solve Mock Tests to gauge preparation and increase the ability to attempt more and reduce wrong attempts.

content.text: India has several prestigious institutions offering specialized MBA programs in Operation Management . These programs combine business management principles with industry-specific knowledge, preparing graduates for leadership roles.

QA_ALL.description: Get insights from 127.9k questions on MBA/PGDM, answered by students, alumni, and experts. You may also ask and answer any question you like about MBA/PGDM

questions.question_text: How are the placement in LPU for MBA students?

answers.answer_text: The MBA placement scenario of LPU is indeed good. In 2025, above 95% of students were placed with 1,129 offers—a 29% increase from the previous year. The highest package touched INR 49.4 LPA, and the top 10% received an average of INR 13.6 LPA from companies like KPMG, ICICI, and Nestlé. More than 130 students got placements above INR 10 LPA.

questions.question_text: How does GIBS help introverted or non-marketing-oriented students crack placements?

answers.answer_text: Honestly, GIBS is pretty good for introverts or non-marketing students because they don't force you to suddenly become outgoing. Through CPM and IRE activities, mock interviews, small presentations, and group tasks, you slowly build confidence without feeling judged. Plus, placements aren't just for marketing — there are HR, finance, analytics, operations, and research roles where quiet and detail-oriented students do really well. The mentors also guide you based on your strengths, so you learn how to present yourself better in interviews. By the time companies come, you're actually ready even if you started off shy.

questions.question_text: Which university offers more good specializations in MBA - LPU or Chandigarh University?

answers.answer_text: Here's a clear comparison of MBA specializations offered by Lovely Professional University (LPU) and Chandigarh University (CU) , focusing on which university gives you more/better options : 📌 Lovely Professional University (LPU) MBA: LPU offers a wide variety of MBA specializations , including both traditional and niche fields . You can choose dual specializations in many areas (two fields). Some of the specializations include: Finance, Marketing, Human Resource Management Business Analytics, International Business Information Technology, Supply Chain & Logistics Hospital & Healthcare Management, Digital Marketing Retail Management, Entrepren

questions.question_text: How are the MBA specializations at Chandigarh University different from those offered at LPU?

answers.answer_text: Lovely Professional University (LPU) and Chandigarh University both offer MBA programs with multiple specializations , but they differ in breadth, focus areas, and structure . LPU's MBA specializations are notably wide-ranging and flexible , allowing students to choose dual specializations or even super specializations . You can become special People Analytics / HR Data Analyst. best of both worlds. questions.question_text: I need help with selecting MBA colleges
Is it a good idea to give multiple MBA entrance exams like CAT CMAT XAT MAT?
questions.answer_text: Yes, giving multiple MBA entrance exams like CAT, CMAT, XAT, and MAT is generally a good idea. Most of the syllabus overlaps, so your preparation works across exams, and it reduces the risk of depending on just one test.Different exams open doors to different colleges. For example, CAT is needed for IIMs, while exams like CMAT, MAT, or NMAT are accepted by many private B-schools. Colleges such as Athena School of Management also consider multiple exams and focus on the overall profile, so having more scores gives you flexibility.Overall, multiple exams simply mean more options and backup choices, which is always helpful.

questions.question_text: Is quality of MBA education declining?
questions.answer_text: I don't think the quality of MBA education is declining overall, but it's becoming very uneven. A lot more colleges have opened in the last few years, so the quality really depends on the institute you choose.Top and mid-tier B-schools still maintain good faculty, internships and placement support. But some smaller colleges don't update their curriculum or offer enough industry exposure, which makes the experience feel outdated.So it's not that MBA quality is falling everywhere — it's just important to pick a college that focuses on practical learning, internships and industry linkages rather than just classroom teaching.

questions.question_text: Top MBA institutes accepting MAT, CMAT and XAT scores.
questions.answer_text: Several well‑known MBA/PGDM institutes in India accept MAT, CMAT, XAT scores — which means aspirants have more flexibility when planning their applications. Some good options are:Jaipuria Institute of Management (Noida, Lucknow, Indore) – Accepts MAT/CMAT/XAT and offers a variety of specializations with strong placement support.Amity University (Noida & other campuses) – Flexible MBA programs, accepts MAT/CMAT, with multiple campuses across India.Xavier Institute of Management and Entrepreneurship (XIME, Bangalore) – Entrepreneurship‑focused, industry‑connected, accepts XAT/MAT/CMAT.Institute of Management Technology (IMT

questions.question_text: Which MBA entrance exam would you prefer for admission to non-Iims? CAT XAT MAT or CMAT?
questions.answer_text: If you're aiming for non-IIM B-schools, all four exams — CAT, XAT, NMAT, and CMAT — can open good options depending on your target colleges.For example, NMAT is accepted by schools like Athena School of Management, NMIMS, and SP Jain Global, which focus on profile-based admissions and industry exposure.XAT and CAT are more competitive and suit those aiming for top-tier institutions, while CMAT and MAT are good for mid-range B-schools.Your choice should depend on your career goals, target institutes, and the type of MBA programme you want — whether corporate-focused, analytical, or global.

questions.question_text: MBA from IIM or M.Tech. From IIT What you have to say?
questions.answer_text: An MBA from IIM is ideal if you aim for leadership, business, or management roles with high salary packages and faster career growth. An M.Tech from IIT suits those interested in technical expertise, research, or academia. Choose MBA for business-driven careers and M.Tech for deep domain specialization. Your career goal should guide your choice.

questions.question_text: Which is the best college for MBA in Noida?
questions.answer_text: If you're looking for the best MBA college in Noida, Amity Business School is a popular option due to its strong academic framework and industry connections. However, the “best” choice really depends on your profile and goals. You can consider getting expert guidance from GOALisB, which offers personalized MBA admissions consulting to help you find the right fit.

questions.question_text: Is it advisable to do integrated program after 12th or to begin with BBA and then MBA.
questions.answer_text: While both options have their own merits, the choice actually depends on your objectives. Here is what you need to be aware of about both programs. Integrated Program (BBA+MBA):Saves time and cost (5 years vs. 6).Offers a streamlined learning path with a focused curriculum.Ideal if you're sure about pursuing an MBA right after 12th.BBA, then MBA:Gives flexibility to gain work experience after BBA.Allows exploration of specialised MBA programs later based on career goals.Perfect if you're still exploring your interests.Personally, I believe that pursuing both BBA & MBA seperately is the best option. questions.question_text: How important is mentor's guidance for MBA entrance exam preparation?
questions.answer_text: Mentor guidance is crucial for MBA entrance exam preparation as it provides personalized support, strategic insights, and motivation. A mentor, like those available at Top best business school GIBS (Global Institute of Business Studies), helps students understand the exam pattern, create effective study plans, and identify strengths and weaknesses. They offer expert advice on time management, problem-solving techniques, and mock test practices. Additionally, mentors provide valuable feedback, which helps in refining preparation strategies. questions.question_text: MBA or M.Sc. Which is best choice?
questions.answer_text: Choosing between an MBA and an M.Sc. depends on your career goals and interests. An MBA, like the one offered at Top best institute GIBS (Global Institute of Business Studies), is ideal for those looking to gain leadership skills, strategic management knowledge, and broad business acumen.It opens up opportunities in various industries, including finance, marketing, consulting, and entrepreneurship. On the other hand, an M.Sc. is more research-oriented and focuses on specialised fields such as science, technology, or social sciences. It is best for those interested in technical expertise, academic research, or specialised professional r

questions.question_text: Executive MBA vs part time MBA.
questions.answer_text: At GIBS, the choice between an Executive MBA (EMBA) and a Part-time MBA depends on your career stage and goals. The EMBA programme at GIBS is tailored for senior professionals and executives who have substantial work experience and seek to enhance their strategic leadership and management skills. It offers a rigorous curriculum, executive-level networking, and global business perspectives, designed for those aiming for top leadership positions.
